title: Axien
text:
Axien is a village and a former municipality in the <a href="Wittenberg%20%28district%29">Wittenberg</a> district in <a href="Saxony-Anhalt">Saxony-Anhalt</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a>. Since 1 January 2011, it is part of the town <a href="Annaburg">Annaburg</a>.
Geography and transport.
The community lies about 35 km southeast of <a href="Wittenberg">Wittenberg</a> and about 20 km north of <a href="Torgau">Torgau</a> in the lowlands on the east bank of the <a href="Elbe">Elbe</a> on an old, now dry, arm of that river. West of the community runs Federal Highway ("Bundesstraße") B 182, and to the north is the B 187. It lies on the "Mid-Germany Church Road". In the south, the community borders on <a href="Saxony">Saxony</a>.
History.
The village of Axien is first documented in the 10th century. The village, however, must have been older, a castle by the name of "Wazgrini" in Axien having been mentioned in 865. It was used as a fortified <a href="bridgehead">bridgehead</a> at a <a href="ford%20%28crossing%29">ford</a> on the Elbe.
